head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden, ¶ 1/9/73. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In reply to your minute, dated 29. Aug., I have the honor to inform you, that in July 1866 in compliance with a request of the hon the Chief Secretary a cop...

div.p: D73/11361, unit 746, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Three file numbers are annotated on the file containing the above letter, 66/ ? 62?? Bot Gard 6.7.66 and 74/1609 follow up to see if relevant. The third is C11478 for which file see the endnotes of W. H. Odgers to M, 4 September 1873.
See notes on printout.
Melbourne bot. Garden,

In reply to your minute, dated 29. Aug., I have the honor to inform you, that in July 1866 in compliance with a request of the hon the Chief Secretary a copy of the printed list of the books, purchased by Government and appended to my parliamentary Report of 1865, was transmitted. I am not aware, that any correspondence on the subject was left at my office, but send now an other copy of the printed document.

div.p: I have the honor to be,
